meanings.definition: A type of magnetic ordering in which neighboring magnetic moments align in opposite directions.
meanings.sent1: Antiferromagnetism occurs when nearby magnetic forces point in different ways.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study antiferromagnetism to understand how magnetic fields interact.
meanings.sent3: The antiferromagnetism in the lab made the compasses go crazy!
meanings.sent4: In the world of magnets, antiferromagnetism is like a dance of opposites.
meanings.sent5: The concept of antiferromagnetism can be puzzling, but it's fascinating to explore.

meanings.definition: The phenomenon of antiferromagnetic materials exhibiting no net magnetic moment at zero temperature.
meanings.sent1: At absolute zero, antiferromagnetism causes materials to have no overall magnetic effect.
meanings.sent2: Researchers investigate antiferromagnetism to unlock the secrets of cold magnetic behavior.
meanings.sent3: The antiferromagnetism in the freezer kept the magnets from sticking together.
meanings.sent4: In the icy realm of zero temperature, antiferromagnetism reigns supreme.
meanings.sent5: The absence of magnetic moment due to antiferromagnetism is like a silent winter night.
